page.title: 05Highbrook - Population
page.content: This is a thinly populated rural area of Mid-Sussex and because it contains no mass cheap housing and generates little economic activity, the poulation is weighted towards the wealthy and the retired. The overall figure remains stable. The elderly tenants living in tied cottages are a remnant of the old estate system which will soon pass as the cottages are usually sold for modernisation on the death of the tenants or the break up of an estate.The large houses are sometimes occupied by families but more often by older people many of whom are newcomers. The nature of these properties demands affluence from their owners but this is rarely based on long term land holding rather earnings from city professions or business.
